incidents.name: Investigating Possible Irregularity for oauth/access_token responses

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.

We have identified and believe to have addressed the issue which may have been causing 403 errors for the oauth/access_token requests.  Affected timeframe is predicted from about 2021-9-30 19:30 UTC -2021-10-3-17:00 UTC.

The Twitter data team is investigating a possible system irregularity currently affecting the OAuth1.0a flow step oauth/access_token responses.  The presence and scope of any customer impact has not been determined at this time, but we will provide an update as soon as we know more.

incidents.name: Delayed Jobs on Batch Compliance API

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
Starting around 17:45 UTC, we've experienced issues with the Batch Compliance API and are currently investigating. Jobs may be delayed once the IDs have been uploaded.

incidents.name: Investigating Possible Irregularity for Twitter API

incident_updates.body: All Twitter APIs are now operational.  Possible affected time frame from 18:45-19:30 UTC. Replay is available.

affected_components.name: Enterprise and Premium Account Activity API

incident_updates.body: The Twitter API team has identified a possible system irregularity currently affecting all Twitter API endpoints.  The presence and scope of any customer impact has not been determined at this time, but we will provide an update as soon as we know more.

affected_components.name: Enterprise and Premium Account Activity API

incidents.name: Detected increase errors across Twitter APIs and Developer Portal

incident_updates.body: We are fully operational across our APIs.

affected_components.name: Enterprise and Premium Account Activity API

incident_updates.body:
Our Developer Portal and most of our Twitter APIs have recovered.

We are still experiencing some errors on Account Activity API and are looking into it.

affected_components.name: Enterprise and Premium Account Activity API

incident_updates.body: We're experiencing an elevated level of errors across our Twitter APIs and Developer Portal starting around 18:16 UTC and are currently investigating. We are still determining the full scope of impact and will provide an update as soon as we know more.

incidents.name: Decreased success rate for Spaces lookup by multiple IDs

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.

We identified an irregularity that causes a decreased success rate for Spaces lookup endpoint when looking up multiple IDs. Developers making requests to these endpoints may see a decrease in the success rate while the irregularity is ongoing.

incidents.name: Detected increase OAuth and Developer Portal errors

incident_updates.body: We've experienced an elevated level of errors starting around 05:25 AM UTC. This affected the ability to create, update, and delete apps in the developer portal. Users would have also experienced intermittent OAuth issues. This was resolved at 10:25 AM UTC.

incidents.name: Data Processing Failures - Ads API Asynchronous Analytics

incident_updates.body: Systems have been monitored over the past few days and metrics have stabilized and improved. We will continue to monitor performance to watch for any significant changes.

We are aware of service issues related to our asynchronous analytics endpoints. This began late last week and is affecting job processing times and job success rates. With that, you may see an increase in job failures. If you encounter errors, you may retry your failed requests. We will follow up with more updates over the next several days.

components.name: Ads API
components.description: Status of the Ads API.

incidents.name: Ads cards created without card_uri parameter

incident_updates.body:
Between 2021-05-14 18:00:0 UTC and 2021-05-15 15:30:00 UTC, the following cards endpoints were incorrectly creating cards where the card_uri would be null. Cards created without the card_uri field cannot be used in Tweets.

POST accounts/:account_id/cards/website
POST accounts/:account_id/cards/video_website
POST accounts/:account_id/cards/image_app_download
POST accounts/:account_id/cards/video_app_download
POST accounts/:account_id/cards/image_conversation
POST accounts/:account_id/cards/video_conversation

Recommended Next Steps: We are investigating whether it is possible to recreate the card_uri field data. If this is blocking advertisers, all cards created during this time using the endpoints listed above and missing the card_uri field should be recreated. After being successfully recreated, we recommend deleting the cards.

Further updates will be available at:
https://twittercommunity.com/t/announcement-cards-created-without-card-uri-parameter-resolved/154175

incidents.name: Investigating Possible Irregularity for Account Activity API and Usage API

incident_updates.body:
Usage API and Account Activity API are both now operating as expected.

Affected time frame between 04/28/2021 19:25UTC - 04/28/2021 20:00UTC.  

Some Account Activity API events may have been missed/not retried.  These events can be recovered using Account Activity API Replay in combination with timelines endpoints.

affected_components.name: Enterprise and Premium Account Activity API

incident_updates.body: The Twitter data team is investigating a possible system irregularity currently affecting Account Activity API webhook delivery and causing delayed Usage information.  The presence and scope of any customer impact has not been determined at this time, but we will provide an update as soon as we know more.

affected_components.name: Enterprise and Premium Account Activity API

incidents.name: Investigating connection and data volume delivery inconsistency for PowerTrack

incident_updates.body: Replay is now available for recovery of data during the affected time period: 15:15 - 16:38 UTC April 17, 2021
We will update the status post once we have more information on Replay availability.
PowerTrack should now be operating as expected, we will continue to monitor.
We are continuing to test and evaluate.

The Twitter data team is investigating and diagnosing connection issues and data volume inconsistency for PowerTrack.  The presence and scope of any customer impact has not been determined at this time, but we will provide an update as soon as we know more.
